text: Jindřich Staněk (born 27 April 1996) is a Czech professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Viktoria Plzeň on loan from Dynamo České Budějovice. He has also represented Czech Republic at youth international level. ==Club career== Staněk started his career with Sparta Prague, appearing on the bench for the first team on three occasions in 2013. On 31 January 2014, he joined Premier League club Everton on a -year deal for an undisclosed fee. On 29 September 2015, Staněk joined Hyde United on a one-month loan deal, who he went on to make five appearances for. In June 2016, having made just two appearances on the bench for Everton, he was released by the club. In September 2016, he joined Czech National Football League side Dynamo České Budějovice, having a loan spell with Třebíč in 2017. In January 2020, Staněk joined league rivals Viktoria Plzeň on loan. ==International career== Staněk has represented Czech Republic at every youth international level from under-16 to under-21. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1996 births Category:People from Strakonice Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Czech footballers Category:Czech Republic youth international footballers Category:Czech First League players Category:Czech National Football League players Category:AC Sparta Prague players Category:Everton F.C. players Category:Hyde United F.C. players Category:SK Dynamo České Budějovice players Category:FC Viktoria Plzeň players Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:Czech expatriate footballers Category:Czech expatriates in England
title: Jindřich Staněk
